reviews.author: Law~
reviews.title: Very Good SSC-SA (so far the best)
reviews.comment_content:
It is a course featuring introductory sociology. The content covers from Crime & Deviance; Family & Gender; Social Inequality; Education and Stratification; and finally Power & Politics.

There are different classical and contemporary theories regarding sociology of different institutions. It provides all-rounded sociological insights to students in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very Good Teaching -- The ideas are clearly expressed and illustrated with examples and some videos.

Many of the videos shown in class are adopted from RTHK HK Connection (é—é˜é›†), or other TV Programs commonly watched by HK-ers. Local Students will find it especially easy to understand :D
reviews.comment_grading:
I was few marks higher than mean in Mid-Term Examination and 1.5 S.D. higher than mean in Final Examination. Essay Score was not released. I attended the classes with in-class exercises (missed one). Final Grade => A and I can say that is totally out of my expectation!

Despite the generous grading policy that I believe Prof. Ku should have adopted, Essay Writing should have played vital role in determining final grade according to other reviews on this course (for Prof. Agnes Ku Session).

The key to success in this course is that you need to have the "Sociological Imagination" which Prof. has mentioned in the first class - It is the ability to relate personal issues (goods or misfortunes) to a wider societal level. This ability applies more significantly to the content after Mid-Term Examination.
reviews.comment_workload:
Major Workload:

1. Attend 3/4 Lectures with In-Class Exercises (featured with video)
2. Attend Mid-term Exam which is conducted in class
3. Attend Final Exam in December
4. A 1000-word Sociological Essay in which you can decide the topic and scope of writing

If you miss the lecture, you can refer to the lecture videos uploaded 1/2 days after the lecture. The exam questions are set mostly based on Lecture notes and Video Content shown in class. A relatively small percentage of questions are set based on Reading Materials.

reviews.author: gpaover4
reviews.title: a good course
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers some fundamental concept of sociology, focusing on the deviance, family, Gender, economy&class inequalities, education, and power&politics.
Prof Ku would focus on a number of the specific area on one chapter and further elaborate it.
I found it quite interesting.
More importantly, the content is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ku is such a good lecturer.
It is easy to follow the lecture.
And the lecture content will be uploaded to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term 35%
exam 40%
essay 25%
class discussion 10%(bonus point)
Both Mid term and final exam above ~1.5s.d
But I am poor in writing the essay.
I finally got a-.
I think it is quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite low.
The essay is around 600-900words.
And the exam and mid-term are only mc questions.
This means you don't have to remember every wording on the notes. But you have to understand the notes a little bit deep. (the mcq is kind of tricky. if u don't understand the concept quite well, you will feel very confused in the examinations.

Hope everyone get a satisfactory grade in this course

reviews.author: catlovers
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting topics covered. Mainly centered around social problems that shaped society into modern form. Topics like deviance, family, inequality, power, education are included in the syllabus.
occasionally some video exercises that count as bonus marks
reviews.comment_teaching:
Rather slow, well spoken English, clear enough
shes a friendly prof who is willing to explain the topics to you bit by bit
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term: 70 something above 0.5 SD
Final: below 1 SD
essay: A-
Final grade: B-, Not so fair but the final is gonna be more tricky
all MC, final: 50-60, mid term 40 questions
she will ask some questions from the compulsory reading materials, you should read them before taking the exam
reviews.comment_workload: a 600-900 word essay(citation not included), took me a week to finish it, better do  it asap. No clear guideline is given so its a free-style essay. Just discuss a social issue or your family from a sociologist point of view. MUST include sociological terms like social theories and citations to support. You can always as the instructor some questions.

reviews.author: Vivian LWL
reviews.comment_content:
Topic included:
Culture& Socialization
Crime and Deviance
Family and Gender
Social/ Class Inequalities
Social Stratification & Education
Power and Politics

Both lecture note and extra readings are given.

No attendance requirement
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching.
It is interesting and she will share many examples.

If you miss one lesson, you can watch the lecture video.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid- term exam (35%)
Final exam (40%)
Essay(25%)
Class Exercise(10 bonus points max.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Only need to study before mid-term exam and final exam.

For essay, you are required to write a sociological essay with any topic about yourself, your family or a social phenomenon. Length of essay is 600-900 words.

reviews.author: yukkkk
reviews.comment_content:
Before Midterm:
Topic I: Culture & Socialization
Topic 2: Crime and Deviance
Topic 3: Family & Gender

After Midterm:
Topic 4: Social/ Class Inequalities
Topic 5: Social Stratification & Education
Topic 6: Power and Politics
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ku's class is so vivid and interesting. Some video clips are shown during the lesson and sometimes you are required to do a short class exercise about the videos. (its just a short question and the class exercises are for you to receive the bonus points on top of your total course score)
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

Exam Format: All are MC, including a few questions asking for application, required readings and the video clips shown in class

Most of the questions are related to the contents of the lecture notes. (the required readings are to help you understand the lectures better)

If you can clarify and memorize the theories well, its not hard to obtain a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
one midterm + one final + one short essay (600-900 words)

Essay is a free topic assignment (about yourself, your family, a friend you've interviewed or a social phenomenon)

reviews.author: non-workaholic
reviews.title: A good choice for CC
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term Exam:
Culture and Socialization
Deviance
Family & Gender

Final Exam:
Class inequalities
Education
Power & Politics

Both mid-term and final exam contain MCs only, and they are all non-accumulative.

All lessons are recorded as lecture videos and there will be class participation mark calculated.
reviews.comment_teaching: A passionate instructor which explained the concept of the course well. Her lessons are interesting and fruitful, sometimes there will be videos played in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam (35%)
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100

Final exam (40%)
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100

Essay (25%)

Attendance (by doing some class exercises) (Bonus marks)
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload except for the essay which will be submitted at the end of the courses (Dec1) before the final exams, and there are some required readings for us to read. They are quite long but informative.

reviews.author: Emerald
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content:
total 6 topics:
-Culture and Socialization
-Family and Gender
-Crime and deviance
-Power and Political
-Education and Social stratification

Not hard to understand as long as you attend the lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
Detailed explanation
likely to explain each theory with examples and applications
and there were lecturer videos provided
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grade. I've got both 1sd above in the mid-term and final exam and finally got an A-. The essay mark was not shown.
There were also class assignments with bonus marks given.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light!!! Only 1 mid-term (MC), 1 Final exam(MC) and 1 short essay.

reviews.author: grqm
reviews.comment_content:
Before midterm:
Culture and socialization
Deviance
Family and gender

After midterm:
Class inequalities
Education
Power and politics

Some of the topics are quite relevant but I think some of those sociological "theories" that attempt to explain society are too arbitrary. Unfortunately this course was all about memorising those theories.
reviews.comment_teaching: I only went to the first lecture and found it boring. It could be because I am never really interested in sociology.
reviews.comment_grading: Surprisingly good. I got an A- with only mean in the midterm and 0.6 sd above mean in the final. And I didn't even go to class (so no bonus points for me).
reviews.comment_workload:
Exams were easy to prepare (multiple choice questions only) and required only memorisation.

The essay could take up to a day to write.

reviews.author: younowho
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

This course introduces you to basic sociological concepts such as deviance, gender, family, class inequalities, education and politics.

The professor will post the lecture notes all in word format onto Canvas before lectures. Every class, she would elaborate the points. Sometimes, she would play videos related to the topic.

The professor was kind enough to take video of every lecture and post it onto Canvas after class. However, sometimes, 1 or 2 videos will be missing due to technical difficulties.

With that said, she took attendance by asking you to submit a short analysis of a video she played in class. She did this for around 4-5 times this semester. You are allowed to skip one of these in-class assignments.

There were readings assigned to each topic.

For the essay, you were required to write around 800 words on any topic related to the content taught in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is a large class with nearly 400 students in LTA. Every class, the professor would just talk about the points on the lecture notes. The content was easily understandable. If you miss some points, you can refer to the video on Canvas.

Sometimes, she would ask questions. A few students may get bonus points if they answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100

Final exam
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100

I got around 1.5SD above mean in both Mid-term and Final Exam. The marks for the essay was not released. In the end, I got an A.

The format of the exams were all MC based. They were quite tricky. For the Mid-term, there were 1-2 questions on the readings. But for the Final Exam, I do not recall any questions that refer to a specific reading. I did not really study the readings.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.

All you have to do is study for the exams and write the essay. I revised a couple of days before the exam and felt alright.

For the readings, you can choose to read them if you are interested.

reviews.author: Eunjiii
reviews.comment_content:
Before midterm:
Culture and socialization
Deviance
Family & gender

After midterm:
Class inequalities
Education
Power & politics
reviews.comment_teaching:
She teaches quite well. Sometimes she would explain some concepts with simple examples. Be aware of falling asleep because her tone is quite dull.

She would play videos during some classes and you can earn bonus points by answering the question given  by the professor (write down your thoughts and feelings towards the question).
reviews.comment_grading:
Statistics for mid-term:
Mean: 68.6/100
SD: 13.88/100

Statistics for final:
Mean: 70.00/100
SD: 14.00/100

Marks for the essay and class exercises/ discussions are not shown.

I am not good at studying sosc courses. I got below ~0.5 sd in both midterm and final exam, finally got B-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

Workload is not too heavy. You have adequate time for doing an essay (around 600 to 900 words).

reviews.author: swaggerjaggerry
reviews.title: Class of memorization
reviews.comment_content:
Culture and socialization
Deviance
Family and Gender
Class Inequalities
Education
Power and Politics

- lecture videos (includes in-class videos)
- lecture notes (summarized)
- supplementary ppt
- assigned readings (tbh no one reads this)
reviews.comment_teaching:
She's just reading off the slides/notes (boooring)
Only a small bit of add-on if u listen to her talk in class (common sense elaboration)
Other than that you can afford to skip a few of her classes (but make sure to watch her lecture videos since exams include qns on in-class vids)
she has these in-class exercises (best 3 grades taken out of 4) so honestly people come to her class bc of this
reviews.comment_grading:
The statistics for the mid-term exam are listed as follows,
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100
The statistics for the final exam are listed as follows,
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100

I got mean for midterm and mean + 0.5 sd for finals (idk what i got for the essay + inclass ex) and i got a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

â€»Exams take the form of MC and/ or short questions. Mid-term exam will cover the topics from the start to Family & Gender; final exam will cover the rest of the topics.1
1 The questions will cover the lectures/ required readings (80-90%) and the video clips shown in class 1

  IV.
â€»An essay, on an individual basis, of 600-900 words is due on 1 December (Friday), 11:59pm (submission via Canvas). The task is to write a sociological essay about yourself, your family or a social phenomenon (suggestions regarding the essay topics will be provided along the way). For the sake of fairness to all, late submissions will receive a penalty and submissions late for more than 3 days will not be accepted.*

Unless you have a photographic memory/flippin good and fast in understanding/memorizing, u gotta fully memorize her lecture notes to be able to ace both tests
Essay is pretty chill, got plenty of time to do it

reviews.author: USTheagod
reviews.title: a nice CC course that you can consider :)
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers six basic topics, including culture & socialization, deviance, family & gender, class inequalities, education and power & politics. The mid-term exam will cover the first three topics and the final exam will cover the remaining three topics. (remark: non-cumulative!)

For me I really enjoy this course as I can have a much better understanding on the society and many basic concepts like capitalism, marxism, structural-functionalism.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is sometimes funny and I can feel that she is excited to teach us sociology!  She often gives detailed elaboration and examples on the concepts and theories which allow me to  better understand those abstract concepts. There're quite a lot of things said by her that are not mentioned in the lecture notes so make sure you attend the class and jot some notes!( or you can just watch the video on canvas)
reviews.comment_grading:
Both the mid-term and final exams are MCQ (38MCQ in midterm and 58 MCQ in final). I was able to finish the paper quickly as the questions were rather straightforward and I think you can quickly know the answer if you have memorized and understood the theories well!

The content is quite easy and as long as you understand the concepts and distinguish between different theories (this is very important and a lot of questions are about comparison between theories and features of a theory), the exam should be easy for you :)

There're a total of 4 class exercises which require you to write a few words on certain topic after watching a video during the lecture. Bonus points will be given if you write well and please note that only the best 3 exercises will be counted so you can skip some lectures just like me xd

MIdterm: (35%)
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100
(mine:84.21, +1.12sd)

Final: (40%)
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100
(mine:87.93, +1.28sd)

Essay (25%) (no stats)

Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite light as there're only a few pages for each topic and you can just revise them just before the exam (but make sure you memorize those theories and sociologists well!!) There's also a very short essay (500-900words) and you can write whatever you like as long as you analyze from a sociological perspective.

However, there're a lot of supplementary readings that are "required" in this course as a few questions may be asked in the exams. Note that there were really 3-4 questions that were asked in the mid-term exam but in the final exam it didn't ask any questions on that!(luckily I didn't read them xd)

reviews.author: tobytam1583
reviews.comment_content: The purpose of this course is to engage you in a conversation about how we can be more sociologically mindful in our understanding of modern life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
interactive teaching style.
and you will get extra credit if you frequently ask question in the class
reviews.comment_grading:
The Final Grade
Midterm Exam            25%
Final Exam                  50% (cumulative)
Written Assignment    25%

mid term and written assignment above 1 sd
final exam mean
finally got B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not high workload
There are some readings you have to read before classes because he will discuss it
Attending every class is a must because the things mentioned in the class will be tested.

reviews.author: HELLO:)
reviews.title: Great sociology course
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers different topics related to sociology, e.g. culture, socialization, deviance, social structure, religion, family education etc.

There is always some interesting fact popping up in the lesson. The concept is not difficult to understand as this is related to our daily lives.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interactive course probably as Professor Groves always encourages us to express the opinion. There are some interesting class experiments for us to participate and let us understand the sociological concepts.

If you want to have a good grade, make sure you jot down what Professor said in the lecture as well as pay attention to the videos played in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% written assignment
25% mid term
50% final exam
(both exams have MCs and short questions)
10% extra for class participation

Midterm exam below mean one mark
Final exam above 0.7 SD
Written assignment full mark
Eventually B+

I think more class participation can contribute to a higher grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not quite heavy as you only need to read 8-10 pages of required reading. You can choose one topic out of two topics and work on it. The written assignment is quite interesting.

Get close to your textbook and required reading in order to achieve higher marks in final exam!

reviews.author: LovelyLilTroll
reviews.comment_content: This is an introductory course to sociology. It covered topics like equality, education, religion, gender...
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures are quite interactive. Groves loves to engage students in discussion. He also prepares class experiments for us to illustrate some sociological concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm exam score (out of 100):
Mean = 72.64
Median = 73.68
SD = 15.02

Final exam score (out of 100):
Mean = 73.45
Median = 75.89
SD = 14.22

The two exams are main contributors to the course grade.  I got a B for a half SD above mean in midterm and one SD above mean in final exam.

The grading system is acceptable. Just participate actively in class. Those bonus points can make a big difference.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low.

There are a lot assigned readings, but most of the concepts and examples are brought up in the lecture. The reading just makes it clear and enriched. So, it is not overwhelming despite the amount.

reviews.author: Sharonluiii
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to Sociology, something like gender, education, equality... As usual, common core content is quite easy, but the readings are a lot a lot a lot, get prepared.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is simply reading the powerpoint with a monotone. Actually it is quite boring, and I felt asleep in a few classes. Sometimes I can hear people snored when the professor was showing videos. Interesting thing is the classroom was full in every single lecture, so need to get there early to grab a seat.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is simply mid term+final+essay+attendance. I attend every classes and  I was below mean for a few marks in the mid term. The final exam result is not shown, but I did not think I performed excellently. The essay feels fine for me although the mark is also not shown... At last I got a A-, which was out of my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload: Simply no assignments for the course, except an essay at the end of semester. Really light workload and I will recommend people to take this course.

reviews.author: AmberM
reviews.comment_content:
Topics were quite interesting. I enjoyed reading the provided reading materials but the amount was HUGE.

**Make sure you memorize the names of those who proposed theories....this kind of question do appear on both midterm and exam...which I ABSOLUTELY HATE.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor combined contents from the reading materials. It is important to pay attention to those details if you do not want to read it outside classes. Videos are also used in lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Got above mean (just above one sd) for both midterm and final. Did not answer or raise any questions during lectures (this is included in your final grade). Missed one in-class activity. Slept in 80% of the classes. Scored A- at the end. But I did study for it because I enjoyed the topics.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much work to do. Just go to class, work on your short essay, go to both midterm and final exam.

reviews.author: CY
reviews.title: 16-17 Fall Good Choice =]
reviews.comment_content:
It covers the following topics:

Culture and Socialization
Deviance
Family
Gender
Social Inequalities
Economy & Class Inequalities
Education
Power & Politics

Mid-term only covers from Deviance up to Gender and Final covers the rest. Content examined in mid-term exam will not be covered in final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ku basically explains the bullet points mentioned in lecture notes in the form of ppt. She has a nice voice. But it might be boring for some who are expecting more vivid teaching approaches.
reviews.comment_grading:
Here are some statistics about the course

Mid-term examination
Mean: 28.85/41
SD: 5.88/41

Final examination
Mean: 40.60/58
SD: 7.94/58

Both mid-term exam and final exam are consisted of only MC questions. For mid-term exam, the questions focus on the content covered on both lecture notes and reading material. Whereas for the final exam, the questions focus nearly almost only on the lecture notes.

Many of the questions require understanding about concepts but some also require strong memorisation. Questions like  Who Proposes What Theory do really occur==

The statistics about the term essay are not revealed to students. Students can only know their final grade

In usual cases, getting average in both mid-term and final ensures a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term exam      35%
Final exam      40%
Essay       25% (To be handed in after final exam)
Class exercises & tutorial discussion (10 bonus points max.)

As you can see, it is fairly light XD

reviews.author: Bravo
reviews.title: Slight Workload but Soso Grade
reviews.comment_content: Introductory course to Sociology, covering topics about gender, poverty, individual perspective, crime, religion. Emphasizing the relationship between individual and society and its impacts on individual.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's teaching style is vivid and interactive. He always wants to engage students to discuss the class materials. He tends to play videos in illustrating his points. A few in-class activities were conducted before midterm exam to inspire students and let them learn the sociology concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: A lot of exam questions are asked based on what he mentioned in class but not in notes. A few questions are also based on the assigned readings. Most of the questions are MCs plus 2-3 short questions (really short). 10% bonus will be given to students based on how actively they participate in class discussion on activity. I think this bonus marks have big impact on the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The assigned readings are quite a lot and tedious. The essay is just one page long. Overall workload is fine.

reviews.author: Bobby Wong
reviews.comment_content: It is an introductory sociology course. covers gender issues, religion, family, and other fundamentals with specific focus on hong kong society, so contents are extremely applicable. the textbook is a very good resource.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor delivers the lecture in a very interesting and interactive way. You will hardly feel bored but may need to pay more attention in the lessons as he speaks quite fast. You can learn through activities or games sometimes. A point to note is the things he told in lessons will be tested. Those content will not be noted in any powerpoints/readings. So attending all lectures is highly recommended.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 midterms(25%) and 1 final(50%) and 1 essay(25%0, mid term below 1 sd, final above mean
final gread: B-
reviews.comment_workload: only one short essay (about 900-1000 words) is required. Although some readings are provide, but is just contribute little in both midterm and final. In midterm, only 2 MC questions about reading. No MC about reading in final.

reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches some introductory   sociology, including 6 topic:
- Culture & Socialization
- Deviance
- Family & Gender
- Class Inequality
- Education
- Power

Professor-made notes are provided.

Wonderful teaching. Lots of examples are provided during lesson. Videos and movies are provided during the lesson. All these material will be discussed during lesson. The instructor will apply the concept and discuss in class. Clear explanation.

The videos and extra slides will be examined in final and midterm.

reviews.author: vs
reviews.title: Amazing professor
reviews.comment_content: introductory sociology course. covers gender issues, religion, family, and other fundamentals with specific focus on hong kong society, so contents are extremely applicable. the textbook is a very good resource.
reviews.comment_teaching: I sing praise about this course and SOSC 2740 (Groves' most advanced undergrad course, in terms of course number). He's a brill lecturer. Shines in huge LT lectures. He provides sound insight into fundamentals of Sociology, and is easily one of (if not the) most interactive lecturer I've yet had. One tip is to take this course (or any of his courses) at an LT.
reviews.comment_grading: the main two contributors towards final grade are the midterm and the final. grading i thought was pretty good...i participated quite a lot in class, got about 1sd above the mean for both exams, got mean on the assignment and managed an A [didn't break the A+ threshold however :( ]
reviews.comment_workload: varied, interesting, rich intro to soc. you have to attend most classes, but workload is low (midterm, final, one A4 page assignment) and exams are ez as long as you go to classes  - as long as you do, you'll be totally fine for both exams. he tends to test a lot on concepts and illustrative examples taught in class. there is some reading material (mainly out of the prescribed textbook), but not at all much.

reviews.author: yung
reviews.comment_content: The course teaches you the sociological phenomenon as the title suggests. I will not say the course will be very helpful if you are not a humanity student. But you can get some idea about how the world behaves or operates.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor delivers the lecture in a very interesting and interactive way. You will hardly feel bored but may need to pay more attention in the lessons as he speaks quite fast. You can learn through activities or games sometimes. A point to note is the things he told in lessons will be tested. Those content will not be noted in any powerpoints/readings. So attending all lectures is highly recommended.
reviews.comment_grading: 2 midterms and 1 final all above mean, some above 1 sd (forgot), got an A- . I heard some classmates are not satisfied with their grade.
reviews.comment_workload: As the course was taken in summer semester, there are 2 mid terms and 1 final. No assignment or project but you have to finish all the readings.
